brief_description: We performed DENV-specific epitope screening studies in the general population of Managua.  Peptides with the capacity to bind HLA DR molecules most common in the Nicaraguan population have been predicted and screened in an HLA matched fashion in blood donors from the Nicaraguan Red Cross previously exposed to dengue virus.
description: We performed DENV-specific epitope screening studies in the general population of Managua.  Peptides with the capacity to bind HLA DR molecules most common in the Nicaraguan population have been predicted and screened in an HLA matched fashion in blood donors from the Nicaraguan Red Cross previously exposed to dengue virus.
hypothesis: Not hypothesis based. Discovery of epitopes in the general population.
objectives: To identify and define CD4 epitopes in the general Nicaraguan population.
official_title: Identification of CD4 Epitopes in the General Nicaraguan Population

arm.description: Buffy coats are collected from the Nicaraguan Red Cross blood bank. PBMCs are isolated and then shipped to the U.S.
arm.name: Nicaragua National Blood Bank Study

personnel.organization: La Jolla Institute for Allergy and Immunology
personnel.site_name: La Jolla Institute for Allergy and Immunology

program.program_name: Protective Immunity Following Dengue Virus Natural Infections and Vaccination
program.contract_name: Protective Immunity Following Dengue Virus Natural Infections and Vaccination
